frameDefinitions: An Entity exists at a particular Location, at a particular Time, as observed by an implicit observer.
An Agent displays a Characteristic of a Standard in his or her own way of behaving.
A Feature of an Entity serves to distinguish the Entity from other members of its type which have a different value for the Feature.
A member or members of a Class have just been  mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance  (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.
This frame contains words that necessarily indicate the motion of two distinct objects.
This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.
frameExamples: Liquid water was <t>present</t> on the surface of Mars billions of years ago.
I guessed he was trying to <t>imitate</t> the movements of a skier
His <t>distinctive</t> flowing gait and skill with the rapier set him apart from his fellows.
My husband left me for <t>another</t> woman -- and now wants to get back together again!
She <t>accompanied</t> him in the ambulance to Hollywood Memorial Hospital.
We <t>searched</t> the yard  for my contact lens.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Entity</fen> whose existence at the <fen>Location</fen> is confirmed.
The <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen>. The <fen>Location</fen> is conceived as a ground for an event of inspection to determine the presense of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Entity</fen> is present at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that borrows a <fen>Characteristic</fen> behavior from a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Characteristic</fen> is a behavior or property that the <fen>Standard</fen> possesses and which the <fen>Agent</fen> adopts in his or her own behavior.
The <fen>Standard</fen> is the entity that exhibits a certain <fen>Characteristic</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> models their own behavior on.
The time at which the imitation occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> imitates some entity which acts as a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The aspect of the <fen>Entity</fen> which makes it different from the other members of its class.
The item which differs from other members of its class in the <fen>Feature</fen>'s value.
The general category of entity which has been referred to.
The instance of the <fen>Class</fen> that is added to the <fen>Initial_set</fen> of entities in the <fen>Class</fen>.
The previously mentioned group of entities of the <fen>Class</fen>.
This is the entity, frequently a living being, which moves in relation to the <fen>Cotheme</fen>. Normally the <fen>Theme</fen> frame element is expressed as an external argument.
This frame element is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique:

<fen>Source</fen> marks any expression which implies a definite starting-point of the motion of the <fen>Cotheme</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the  object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.

<fen>Path</fen> marks phrases that describe the <fen>Theme</fen> and <fen>Cotheme</fen>'s trajectory of motion and which are neither expressions of the  <fen>Source</fen> nor the <fen>Goal</fen> of motion. The notion <fen>Path</fen> also includes directional expressions.

Any expression which tells where the <fen>Cotheme</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>. Note that if the <fen>Cotheme</fen> is animate, the <fen>Theme</fen> need not also end up in the same place. Some particles imply the existence of a <fen>Goal</fen> which is understood in the context of utterance.

<fen>Area</fen> marks expressions which describe a general area in which the motion of <fen>Theme</fen> and <fen>Cotheme</fen> takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. Locative setting adjuncts of motion expressions may also be assigned this frame element.
Phrases that denote a physical path on which the motion of <fen>Theme</fen> and <fen>Cotheme</fen> takes place are marked <fen>Road</fen>.
The direction in which the <fen>Theme</fen> and <fen>Cotheme</fen> move.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the motion occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location which provides a setting for a defined motion (that is one with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>).
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This role can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:
An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>  that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is scrutinizing the <fen>Ground</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Mimic Snotlings do n't really think for themselves, <fex>they</fex> merely mimic the actions of Orcs and Goblins around them.
They were all mimicking <fex>my accent</fex>.
The singer says Gwen has copied <fex>her</fex> in many different ways.
That never depleting ammo in his arsenal - his signature <fex>smile</fex> - is contagious.
These signatures may be distinctive <fex>of the entire Chlamydiales order</fex>.
My Husband left me for another <fex>man</fex>!
There was <fex><t>another</t> power outage</fex> today.
A further five incursions <fex>over and above those noted for 1995</fex> took place in the first three months of 1996.
<fex>Pat</fex> accompanied me for five miles in a blue Toyota.
Pat accompanied <fex>me</fex> down the street.
The cat chased the mouse <fex>out of the house</fex>.
The bikers followed the truck <fex>west</fex>.
The children chased the ball <fex>into the park</fex>. (The children end up in the park.)
The police followed the suspects <fex>all around town</fex>.
The police followed the suspect <fex>on the interstate</fex> for several miles.
The tracking dogs chased their target <fex>towards the river</fex>, where they lost it.
<fex>Leslie</fex> examined the glass for cracks.
Leslie examined <fex>the glass</fex> for cracks.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> examined the case for free speech.
The temperature controller monitored the temperature <fex>with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.
